Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, both the interior and exterior are covered with a cream-coloured slip, now flaked away in places, and bear faint traces of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394597) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394597)
